MATH1106.Title: Modeling with Calculus for the Life Sciences
MATH1106.Specific Requirements: Comments Prerequisite: three years of high school mathematics (including trigonometry and logarithms) or a precalculus course (e.g., MATH 1101). No prior knowledge of calculus is required. Students who plan to take more than one semester of calculus should take MATH 1110 rather than MATH 1106. For guidance in selecting an appropriate course, please consult First Steps in Math.

MATH1110.Title: Calculus I
MATH1110.Specific Requirements: Comments Prerequisite: three years of high school mathematics (including trigonometry and logarithms) or a precalculus course (e.g., MATH 1101). MATH 1110 can serve as a one-semester introduction to calculus or as part of a two-semester sequence in which it is followed by MATH 1120. For guidance in selecting an appropriate course, please consult First Steps in Math.

MATH1120.Title: Calculus II
MATH1120.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1110, excellent performance in MATH 1106, or equivalent AP credit.

MATH1910.Title: Calculus for Engineers
MATH1910.Specific Requirements: Comments Prerequisite: three years high school mathematics, including trigonometry and logarithms, and at least one course in differential and integral calculus, or equivalent AP credit. For guidance in selecting an appropriate course, please consult First Steps in Math.

MATH1920.Title: Multivariable Calculus for Engineers
MATH1920.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1910 or equivalent AP credit.

MATH2210.Title: Linear Algebra
MATH2210.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1110-MATH 1120 with high performance, equivalent AP credit, or permission of department.

MATH2310.Title: Linear Algebra for Data Science
MATH2310.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1106, MATH 1110, or equivalent AP credit.

MATH3040.Title: Prove It!
MATH3040.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH3110.Title: Introduction to Analysis
MATH3110.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH3320.Title: Introduction to Number Theory
MATH3320.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH3340.Title: Abstract Algebra
MATH3340.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH3360.Title: Applicable Algebra
MATH3360.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4030.Title: History of Mathematics
MATH4030.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: two mathematics courses above 3000, or permission of instructor.

MATH4130.Title: Honors Introduction to Analysis I
MATH4130.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: high level of performance in a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4180.Title: Complex Analysis
MATH4180.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2230-MATH 2240, MATH 3110, or MATH 4130, or permission of instructor.

MATH4200.Title: Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems
MATH4200.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4260.Title: Numerical Analysis: Linear and Nonlinear Problems
MATH4260.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210 or MATH 2940 or equivalent, knowledge of programming, CS 3220 or CS 4210/MATH 4250, or permission of the instructor.

MATH4310.Title: Linear Algebra
MATH4310.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4500.Title: Matrix Groups
MATH4500.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4540.Title: Introduction to Differential Geometry
MATH4540.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4720.Title: Statistics
MATH4720.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 4710 and linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent).

MATH4740.Title: Stochastic Processes
MATH4740.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 4710, BTRY 3080/ILRST 3080/STSCI 3080, ORIE 3500, or ECON 3130 and linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent).

MATH5200.Title: Differential Equations and Dynamical Systems
MATH5200.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH1105.Title: Finite Mathematics for the Life and Social Sciences
MATH1105.Specific Requirements: Comments Prerequisite: three years of high school mathematics, including trigonometry and logarithms.

MATH1710.Title: Statistical Theory and Application in the Real World
MATH1710.Specific Requirements: Comments Prerequisite: high school mathematics. No previous familiarity with computers presumed.

MATH2230.Title: Theoretical Linear Algebra and Calculus
MATH2230.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1110-MATH 1120 with a grade of A- or better, equivalent AP credit, or permission of instructor.

MATH3210.Title: Manifolds and Differential Forms
MATH3210.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH3270.Title: Introduction to Ordinary Differential Equations
MATH3270.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4210.Title: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
MATH4210.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: high level of performance in a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4220.Title: Applied Complex Analysis
MATH4220.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH4250.Title: Numerical Analysis and Differential Equations
MATH4250.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230-MATH 2240, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940 or equivalent and one additional mathematics course numbered 3000 or above.

MATH4330.Title: Honors Linear Algebra
MATH4330.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: high level of performance in MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4370.Title: Computational Algebra
MATH4370.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4410.Title: Introduction to Combinatorics I
MATH4410.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4530.Title: Introduction to Topology
MATH4530.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4810.Title: Mathematical Logic
MATH4810.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH5220.Title: Applied Complex Analysis
MATH5220.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: a semester of linear algebra (MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940) and a semester of multivariable calculus (MATH 2220, MATH 2240, or MATH 1920), or equivalent.

MATH5250.Title: Numerical Analysis and Differential Equations
MATH5250.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230-MATH 2240, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940 or equivalent, and one additional mathematics course numbered 3000 or above.

MATH5410.Title: Introduction to Combinatorics I
MATH5410.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH3620.Title: Dynamic Models in Biology
MATH3620.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses and completion of mathematics requirements for biological sciences major or equivalent.

MATH3810.Title: Deductive Logic
MATH3810.Specific Requirements: Prerequistite: PHIL 2310 or MATH 2210 or MATH 2230 or permission of instructor.

MATH4420.Title: Introduction to Combinatorics II
MATH4420.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH5420.Title: Introduction to Combinatorics II
MATH5420.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH3850.Title: Modal Logic
MATH3850.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: at least one prior course in philosophy, preferably in logic.

MATH4520.Title: Classical Geometries and Modern Applications
MATH4520.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH4860.Title: Applied Logic
MATH4860.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2940, or equivalent.

MATH2130.Title: Calculus III
MATH2130.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 1120, MATH 1910, or equivalent AP credit.

MATH2810.Title: Deductive Logic
MATH2810.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: PHIL 2310, or MATH 2210, or MATH 2230 or permission of instructor.

MATH3230.Title: Introduction to Differential Equations
MATH3230.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: multivariable calculus and linear algebra (e.g., MATH 2210-MATH 2220, MATH 2230-MATH 2240, or MATH 1920 and MATH 2940), or permission of instructor.

MATH4315.Title: Linear Algebra with Supplements
MATH4315.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: MATH 2210, MATH 2230, MATH 2310, or MATH 2940. Students will be expected to be comfortable with proofs.

MATH4560.Title: Geometry of Discrete Groups
MATH4560.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: an introduction to groups via MATH 3340, MATH 3360, MATH 4340, or MATH 4500, or permission of instructor. Students will be expected to be comfortable with proofs.

MATH4820.Title: Topics in Logic and the Foundations of Mathematics
MATH4820.Specific Requirements: Prerequisite: PHIL 2310, MATH 2810/PHIL 3310, MATH 3840/PHIL 3300, or permission of instructor, plus a background in logic.
